result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard G. Musland was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).
  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant is entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges. The court has no objection to the sentence being served in another jurisdiction.

records.addlTxt: Photos given to the Court by DA Blader at the November 4, 2014 Plea/sentencing hearing
CCAP record for the defendant given to the Court by DA Blader at the November 4, 2014 Plea/sentencing hearing.

Case called @ 11:23 a.m. Defendant Richard G. Musland in court with attorney Ryan S. Ulrich.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Cts 2-4 - NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Cts 1 & 5 - DRI. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Atty Ulrich. Statement by DE. Court orders: Ct 2- 30 days WCJ, Cts 3 & 4 - 100 days WCJ - Concurrent - Huber, GT, 1 day CFTS - Sentence to commence by no later than 12-01-2014, Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. The court has no objection to the sentence being served in another jurisdiction. Appeal rights given.
Plea hearing on November 4, 2014 at 11:00 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant Richard G. Musland in court with attorney Ryan S. Ulrich.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Ulrich requests 30 additional days for plea hearing.  Plea hearing scheduled for November 4, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 26, 2014 at 02:15 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Ryan S. Ulrich in court.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Ulrich requesting a P/S hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 26, 2014 at 02:15 pm.
Status conference on September 2, 2014 at 09:55 am.
Status conference on July 22, 2014 at 10:20 am.

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 1:40 PM: Defendant Richard G. Musland in court with attorney Ryan S Ulrich.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived.  Court entertains waiver of time limits for pre-lim hearing.  Court accepts knowing and voluntary waiver of time limits for pre-lim hrg.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for July 22, 2014 at 10:20 am.
Initial appearance on June 20, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.    Not to be in the possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription as to the medication and proper quantity. Defendant is prohibited from consuming any illegal substances.

Case called @ 1:07 p.m. Defendant Richard G. Musland in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Bryan D Keberlein.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be represented by SPD. ADA Anderson requesting $5000 Sig Bond. No objection by Atty Keberlein. Court orders $5000 Sig Bond w/ conditions. IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for June 20, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
